TextView.android:text: Most important rule: KEEP THE INVENTORY UPDATED \n

a)Know where safety equipment lies(like first aid, fire extinguisher, etc)
 b)Know what you are using. Along with the safety needed to use it.
 c)Keep tools exactly where you found them, in the same configuration. Tip: take a pic when you are picking it up
 d)No cutting without clamping
 e)Any power tool must be turned off after work. Don't just pull the plug directly.
 f)When entering the car area, remove cones to enter, dont jump over them.
 g)No grinding and cutting near the car when the safety systems are mounted.
 h) Extreme safety during dry runs and people must be notified about it.

a)Keep unknown/used wires in a box
 b)Don't connect too many devices to one extension board. It may burn/be damaged.
 c)Always turn off all switches of all components that have been used, after use. Keep the power supply knobs to 0 after use.
 d)HV area rules: no food, no water, no metal items like watches, no working if sleepy/sick/high. Also use only HV specified tools for the HV area(including the jacket)
 e) Careful around the soldering area, temperatures run high there(when someone is working)
